programme.title: Les ambassadeurs
programme.desc: The beautiful villages of the Pays de Herve We take a wander through the Pays de Herve, in the Province of Liège, from one beautiful village to the next: Olne, Soiron, Clermont-sur-Berwinne. So many delightful spots to take a break amidst the patchwork of fields, copses and hedgerows, the stone-built houses and the footpaths. Presented by: Armelle, Guy Lemaire, Jean-Philippe Watteyne.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: The thinning air The last 200 metres to the peak of Mont-Blanc require a great deal of energy from the young climbers. Nothing is certain. During the expedition, they hope to go at least 1000 metres higher. Until then, they also learn how to attract money and sponsors. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Ding dong : montre-moi ta maison !
programme.desc:
Episode 1

A little crooked house... but can a house really be crooked, literally? Who lives in a villa with direct lake access? How to blossom in a rainbow-coloured house next to a railway line? Viola Tami invites us to discover some surprising buildings and their occupants. Presented by: Viola Tami.

Directed by: Karen Ballmer (Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Les saisons de Pique-assiette
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Chroniques d'en haut
programme.desc:
Aravis, around Annecy
Laurent invites us to join him as he discovers this region between Lake Annecy and the Aravis mountain range, as seen by those who live there.
Presented by: Laurent Guillaume.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Monaco special Behind the scenes at the famous Monte-Carlo casino. Encounter with the chef Marcel Ravin in charge of the kitchens of the Monte-Carlo Bay Hotel & Resort, where he offers an innovative and sophisticated gastronomic cuisine. Gaming and roulette tables: the expertise of the Monte-Carlo workshops. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: Fun, colourful and made in France, Jean-Simon Roch's creations impress both young and old alike. The designer invites us to explore his magical world. Then, to discover all there is to know about wood, we meet the cabinetmaker Morgane Ricada. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Les ambassadeurs
programme.desc: Manhay In the heart of the Belgian Ardennes, Manhay is an unmissable destination for all who love nature and outdoor sports. Vast stretches of forest, landscapes of rolling countryside, the peaceful and picturesque villages of the Haute Ardenne, the municipality of Manhay has successfully retained its all authentic rural character. Presented by: Armelle, Guy Lemaire, Jean-Philippe Watteyne.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Departure time The team meets for the final preparations at the Swiss Alpine Club's headquarters in Berne. There are tonnes of equipment to pack, and final briefings with the doctors accompanying them about medicines and rescue possibilities in China and the available meteorological services Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Ding dong : montre-moi ta maison !
programme.desc:
Episode 2
Viola begins by offering us a tour of an amazing house, its roof and walls covered by solar panels. Then she visits a surprising home-workshop-studio belonging to an artist-shepherd and a magnificent villa with direct lake access and an owner who is somewhat unusual ... to say the least.
Presented by: Viola Tami. Directed by: Karen Ballmer (Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Les saisons de Pique-assiette
programme.sub-title: Fregola aux coques, fèves et artichauts
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Chroniques d'en haut

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the French Senate, a building steeped in history. Ceramists from father to son, we meet François from the Jean Roger family. Three addresses for all fans of turntables and vinyl records. Focus on the chistera, the strange wicker glove emblematic of the Basque game of pelota. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: Karen Swami has her feet firmly on the ground and both hands in the earth. An encounter with a ceramist unlike any other. The bronze medal may not be the most prestigious, but the metal used to make it is far more precious than you might think... Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Les ambassadeurs
programme.desc: Manhay In the heart of the Belgian Ardennes, Manhay is an unmissable destination for all who love nature and outdoor sports. Vast stretches of forest, landscapes of rolling countryside, the peaceful and picturesque villages of the Haute Ardenne, the municipality of Manhay has successfully retained its all authentic rural character. programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Diois
We head for the Diois, in the company of Alain, to discover a world of colour and scent in his lavender fields. Céline collects pollen from her hives. A watery journey, through the Bouligons marshes and along the river Drôme. All about the Clairette de Die.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Natural attractions near Dijon A few kilometres from Dijon, between the river and the forest, lies a land boasting many resources: the Val-Suzon. Guillaume sets off to meet the fans of this conservation area where the forest is still a source of great emotion... And truffles! Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Bordeaux court of appeal. Textile designer Sophie Mallebranche weaves metal thread using innovative industrial techniques. Discovering the Paris of the workers. A poetic stroll in the area around Rouen, where the porcelain sculptures by the ceramist Marik Korus take the colour white to another level. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: Fun, colourful and made in France, Jean-Simon Roch's creations impress both young and old alike. The designer invites us to explore his magical world. Then, to discover all there is to know about wood, we meet the cabinetmaker Morgane Ricada. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc: Spotlight on headgear by La Cerise sur le Chapeau. All there is to know about the roll neck. Encounter with André Sakellarides, stringed-instrument maker in Marseille. How to wear wellington boots. A deliciously sweet visit to a veritable institution in Lille: Maison Meert reveals the recipe for its waffles. Commentary: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
François Gagnaire
Chef François Gagnaire, today based in Paris, returns to the Haute-Loire and his town of Le Puy-en-Velay, where he has never been forgotten. We accompany him on a distinctly foodie pilgrimage, across the region that revealed his talent and where he earned his first Michelin star.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life on a multigenerational farm In Saskatchewan, Julien settles on a farm that's totally off-grid and into the radically ecological lifestyle of its inhabitants. And he's about to learn a lot from this family that lives its convictions to the full! Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Beet cupcakes
Ricardo prepares a root vegetable for dessert: beet cupcakes topped with mascarpone cream and drizzled with beet syrup.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc:
En-route for the Gras de Douarnenez
With five days of festivities the Gras de Douarnenez is a carnival on a grand scale! One of the last in Brittany or even in France, this fabulous celebration, open to everyone and every age, sees the entire town dress up and enjoy a chance to laugh at absolutely anything. Report by: Nina Montagné.
Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: In Paris we head off to visit to the Pantheon. Prepare to enter those areas where no-one else goes! Then an encounter with Philippe Perissé, a fashion designer inspired by the world of heroines. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc:
The Liberation of Paris Museum/Pierre Marty/Off-White/Plumavera.
The Liberation of Paris Museum recounts the Second World War. Chef Pierre Marty at work in the kitchens of "Ducasse sur Seine", a boat unlike any other. Off-White, with its extravagant fabrics and over-sized volumes. An in-depth look at Plumavera's exquisite expertise with feathers.
Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Magret de canard aux quatre baies
programme.desc: Duck breast with a four pepper sauce Pasquale Vari presents her duck breast with roast Brussels sprouts and explains how to make a four pepper sauce. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Nos maisons
programme.desc: Maison de vétéran In the middle of the 20th century, to solve the housing crisis, Canada saw the construction of tens of thousands of quick-build houses, each to the same square design: known as "wartime housing" or "maisons de vétérans". Directed by: Mathieu Baer (Canada, 2019)

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes in the Church of Saint-Sulpice, in the heart of the Odéon district. Welcome to the plant-inspired dreamland of a multidisciplinary artist, Eloïse Van der Heyden. Three all-essential haute couture addresses. Encounter with Louis Monier, carpenter and artist, Meilleur Ouvrier de France, creator of traditional and contemporary seating. Presented by: Katherina Marx.
